properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: device_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of device

properties.name: address_family
properties.description: (Required) ipv4 or ipv6

properties.name: default_route
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name for the Connect resource

properties.name: facility
properties.description: (Required) Facility where to create the VLAN

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of parent project

properties.name: list description
Azure ExpressRoute - "ed5de8e0-77a9-4d3b-9de0-65281d3aa831"
properties.description: • Azure ExpressRoute - "ed5de8e0-77a9-4d3b-9de0-65281d3aa831"

properties.name: provider_payload
properties.description: (Required) Authorization key for the Connect provider

properties.name: port_speed
properties.description: (Required) Port speed in Mbps

properties.name: vxlan
properties.description: (Required) VXLAN Network identifier of the linked Packet VLAN
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: (Required) The device name

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the project in which to create the device

properties.name: operating_system
properties.description: (Required) The operating system slug. To find the slug, or visit Operating Systems API docs, set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

properties.name: facilities
properties.description: List of facility codes with deployment preferences. Packet API will go through the list and will deploy your device to first facility with free capacity. List items must be facility codes or any (a wildcard). To find the facility code, visit Facilities API docs, set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

properties.name: plan
properties.description: (Required) The device plan slug. To find the plan slug, visit Device plans API docs, set your auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

properties.name: billing_cycle
properties.description: (Required) monthly or hourly

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: (Optional) - A string of the desired User Data for the device.

properties.name: public_ipv4_subnet_size
properties.description: (Optional) - Size of allocated subnet, more information is in the Custom Subnet Size doc.

properties.name: ipxe_script_url
properties.description: (Optional) - URL pointing to a hosted iPXE script. More information is in the Custom iPXE doc.

properties.name: always_pxe
properties.description: (Optional) - If true, a device with OS custom_ipxe will continue to boot via iPXE on reboots.

properties.name: hardware_reservation_id
properties.description: (Optional) - The full ID of the hardware reservation where you want this device deployed, or next-available if you want to pick your next available reservation automatically.

properties.name: storage
properties.description: (Optional) - JSON for custom partitioning. Only usable on reserved hardware. More information in in the Custom Partitioning and RAID doc.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: Tags attached to the device

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description string for the device

properties.name: project_ssh_key_ids
properties.description: Array of IDs of the project SSH keys which should be added to the device. If you omit this, SSH keys of all the members of the parent project will be added to the device. If you specify this array, only the listed project SSH keys will be added. Project SSH keys can be created with the [packet_project_ssh_key][packet_project_ssh_key.html] resource.

properties.name: network_type
properties.description: (Optional) - Network type of device, used for Layer 2 networking. Allowed values are layer3, hybrid, layer2-individual and layer2-bonded. If you keep it empty, Terraform will not handle the network type of the device.

properties.name: ip_address_types
properties.description: (Optional) - A set containing one or more of [private_ipv4, public_ipv4, public_ipv6]. It specifies which IP address types a new device should obtain. If omitted, a created device will obtain all 3 addresses. If you only want private IPv4 address for the new device, pass [private_ipv4].

properties.name: wait_for_reservation_deprovision
properties.description: (Optional) - Only used for devices in reserved hardware. If set, the deletion of this device will block until the hardware reservation is marked provisionable (about 4 minutes in August 2019).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: device_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of device to which to assign the subnet

properties.name: cidr_notation
properties.description: (Required) CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same project and facility as the device
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Organization.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description string.

properties.name: website
properties.description: Website link.

properties.name: twitter
properties.description: Twitter handle.

properties.name: logo
properties.description: Logo URL.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: device_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

properties.name: port_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of network port to be assigned to the VLAN

properties.name: force_bond
properties.description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false.

properties.name: vlan_vnid
properties.description: VXLAN Network Identifier, integer

properties.name: native
properties.description: (Optional) Mark this VLAN a native VLAN on the port. This can be used only if this assignment assigns second or further VLAN to the port. To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use depends_on pointing to another packet_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above.

properties.name: attribute-referece
properties.description: » Attribute Referece

properties.name: id
properties.description: UUID of device port used in the assignment

properties.name: vlan_id
properties.description: UUID of VLAN API resource

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: UUID of device port
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the project

properties.name: organization_id
properties.description: The UUID of organization under which you want to create the project. If you leave it out, the project will be create under your the default organization of your account.

properties.name: payment_method_id
properties.description: The UUID of payment method for this project. The payment method and the project need to belong to the same organization (passed with organization_id, or default).

properties.name: backend_transfer
properties.description: Enable or disable Backend Transfer, default is false

properties.name: bgp_config
properties.description: Optional BGP settings. Refer to Packet guide for BGP.
Once you set the BGP config in a project, it can't be removed (due to a limitation in the Packet API). It can be updated.
The bgp_config block supports:

properties.name: asn
properties.description: Autonomous System Numer for local BGP deployment

properties.name: md5
properties.description: (Optional) Password for BGP session in plaintext (not a checksum)

properties.name: deployment_type
properties.description: private or public, the private is likely to be usable immediately, the public will need to be review by Packet engineers
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the SSH key for identification

properties.name: public_key
properties.description: (Required) The public key. If this is a file, it can be read using the file interpolation function

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of parent project
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The packet project ID where to allocate the address block

properties.name: quantity
properties.description: (Required) The number of allocated /32 addresses, a power of 2

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Either "global_ipv4" or "public_ipv4", defaults to "public_ipv4" for backward compatibility

properties.name: facility
properties.description: (Optional) Facility where to allocate the public IP address block, makes sense only for type==public_ipv4, must be empty for type==global_ipv4

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Arbitrary description
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the SSH key for identification

properties.name: public_key
properties.description: (Required) The public key. If this is a file, it can be read using the file interpolation function
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: devices_max
properties.description: (Required) Maximum number devices to be created

properties.name: devices_min
properties.description: (Required) Miniumum number devices to be created

properties.name: max_bid_price
properties.description: (Required) Maximum price user is willing to pay per hour per device

properties.name: facilities
properties.description: (Required) Facility IDs where devices should be created

properties.name: instance_parameters
properties.description: (Required) Device parameters. See device resource for details

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) Project ID

properties.name: wait_for_devices
properties.description: (Optional) On resource creation

properties.name: timeouts
properties.description: » Timeouts
The timeouts block allows you to specify timeouts for certain actions:

properties.name: create
properties.description: (Defaults to 60 mins) Used when creating the Spot Market Request and wait_for_devices == true)

properties.name: delete
properties.description: (Defaults to 60 mins) Used when destroying the Spot Market Request and wait for devices == true
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of parent project

properties.name: facility
properties.description: (Required) Facility where to create the VLAN

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description string
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: plan
properties.description: (Required) The service plan slug of the volume

properties.name: facility
properties.description: (Required) The facility to create the volume in

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The packet project ID to deploy the volume in

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required) The size in GB to make the volume

properties.name: billing_cycle
properties.description: The billing cycle, defaults to "hourly"

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional description for the volume

properties.name: snapshot_policies
properties.description: Optional list of snapshot policies

properties.name: locked
properties.description: Lock or unlock the volume
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: volume_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the volume to attach

properties.name: device_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the device to which the volume should be attached
